website_summaries.verdict: Worn by Navy SEALs and special ops programs, super-durable IST fins are an excellent choice for deep-sea diving, spearfishing, and scuba diving.
pros: Wide range of sizes available, from medium to XXXL
Designed for a strong thrust and superior propulsion
cons: While IST creates premium fins, they are fairly expensive, and only available in black

customer_reviews.title: Good fins with a critical flaw
customer_reviews.text: These are great fins at an economical price compared to similar Jet Fins with similar performance. The problem with them is that the rubber compound is substantially lower quality, and the foot pockets inevitably start to tear after a year or two of use, or sooner if you really push them. I've had this happen on several pairs now, so it is not an isolated occurrence, it's a design issue. They do have a year's warranty, so keep an eye out for this problem and you may be able to get them replaced under warranty rather than having to buy new. I would still recommend them, but with this issue disclosed.
customer_reviews.author: B.R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 sets of these fins and wouldn't buy anything else. They help keep me neutrally buoyant, are very thick/not prone to damage, and are long lasting. I make sure to clean them after every dive/swim regardless of what type of environment they have been in, and not let them sit in the sun or dry areas. The portion that sits on top of the foot could be more durable as I have noticed it starts to tear in that location before any other. There is a reason these fins have been the go to for special forces for over 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fit my son's size 14 feet!
customer_reviews.text: We had a REALLY hard time finding fins for my son's feet because of the size - he was a size 14 wide. This are great fins and fit really well with his neoprene boots. They are more rigid than other fins and require a little more kick, but are just what he needed to be able to dive!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Love these things.
customer_reviews.text: These are serious fins. They are heavy and take strong legs , quite like navy seal fins. I routinely spear fish and free dive at 50 ft or more and always surprise others or even spear fishing guides that my fins are not the 3 feet long fins and yet we go deep and fast. They easily fit in luggage but are pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great Fins, Terrible size chart
customer_reviews.text: Great quality fin! Ordered a XXL per chart, with 5mm booties it fits good not great. Wish I ordered the XL. But overall best fins out there.
customer_reviews.author: Exotic Cat

customer_reviews.title: Bad Fins
customer_reviews.text: Only used these fins 4 times and they are falling apart on me. At the top of the foot holes of both fins there are huge rips down the sides and one of the moldings for the strap clamps is ripping off just from light use
customer_reviews.author: brody

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile fins on the market!
customer_reviews.text: These are great fins! Whether training for functional program, or going diving, these fins can do it all. I have heard negative backlash that they are too heavy, but what it comes down to is training in them and getting used to their fit. Would recommend for anyone training for selections or for a true scuba diver.
customer_reviews.author: Tombets

customer_reviews.title: I recommend for short and medium range fining
customer_reviews.text: These fins push water so well, I can swim circles around those that don't have the directed channels. I recommend for short and medium range fining.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Way

customer_reviews.title: Size chart incorrect.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered according to size chart, XL, 9-10. Size on packaging is XL, 11-13. Tried on and they are too big. I do like the fins. Tried them on with my river shoes for a better fit. Will keep, but disappointed I received the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: k essa

customer_reviews.title: Fast fins
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson for Christmas and he thinks they’re absolutely awesome and perfect fit once he got the socks to go with them
customer_reviews.author: dm640kindle

customer_reviews.title: Not  Military Grade Stiffness
customer_reviews.text: The fins claim to be MILITARY CHOICE — #1 choice for Special Ops and U.S. Navy SEAL. They are not. The rubber is not near as stiff and durable as my old US Divers rocket fins. They may be fine if that is not what you expect. I returned them with no problem. I will continue to look for the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Long

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Well made, durable and work well in all types of water (ocean and lake and pool with chlorine)
customer_reviews.author: 3RowerMom

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to turtle fins
customer_reviews.text: As a commercial diver, I dive with Muck boots. The pocket in these find are large enough to accommodate a size 11 Muck boot. They stand up to the abuse of sliding down piles very well. Great alternative to turtle fins.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: I would hate to be wearing these in dark water because you ...
customer_reviews.text: These fins are as advertised. As is typical with this style, they are very heavy. I have been wearing them with Chuck Taylors as a liner and they function very well. The strap system does not hold up to abuse. A careless kick off the bottom will unbuckle them, which results in an awkward one-finned dive and retrieval. I would hate to be wearing these in dark water because you may end up losing one before you even know it.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and unbeatable price and quality! Will be purchasing more gear.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Every bit as good as the fins I trained with as a Navy Diver. Half the price as anything you will find in a dive shop.
customer_reviews.author: USNCPO

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my son. They are a very heavy and will take some time to get use to. They seem to be very well constructed. Does take a while to "break" them in. He is in the pool 4-5 days a week. He is happy with their performance.
customer_reviews.author: SassyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality fins at an unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality fins at an unbeatable price. If you're training for the military these are a great alternative to the aqua lung rockets that are really pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Abel

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: A friend who swears by ScubaPro has a similar pair of fins. The only difference I can see is 1) Logo (mine don't have any) 2) The strap - she has bungee which is easier to put on/pull off, which this pair is a simple rubber strap, which I did struggle to get off my left foot every time. I do not have any problem getting the one off my right foot, so it may be an issue with the adjustment of the tightness of the strap. It WOULD have been easier if it was bungee instead, for sure. 3) Price. Hers is a lot more expensive, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Aiamu

customer_reviews.title: Super tough durable strong heavy
customer_reviews.text: I love the work out these things give me I don't like that I have to continually tighten the straps over and over again. They are built so sturdy and durable I cannot imagine anything going wrong with them I will be replacing straps with some nicer stronger easier to just straps
customer_reviews.author: RU12HI5

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty fins
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty fins. This is the best alternative if you don't want to spend all the money on rocket fins
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Fins
customer_reviews.text: These are the best fins I have ever used. Quite short compared to normal dive fins but if you are looking at them for military swim training then they are perfect. They are great quality fins and I'm size 12 shoe and they fit perfect. XXL
customer_reviews.author: Luke Allen

customer_reviews.title: Would hate to lose these
customer_reviews.text: Love them, I have had the same pair since 2013 and have dove, worked out and used these fins for recreational use and they are still in great shape. The only thing that broke was the fin strap after a couple years. Replaced with a spring strap and haven’t had any issues since .
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Probably should replace back straps with springs but otherwise awesome fins. My girlfriend and I both own these and love them for scuba.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, according to the recipient
customer_reviews.text: My son says he noticed the difference on his first dive - he used O2 much more slowly because he was expending less energy.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Right fit - Awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you everyone for your support when I had questions about this product. I was able to order the right size and it fit perfectly for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fins.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, use them all the time. Got them because recommended by SEALs for long swims with less fatigue. Overpowered for me but I take them everywhere now, ocean, pond, swimming pool (if they'reallowed). Adjustable sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn other brand flippers and I have to say I really like these. The are comfortable, slightly large but I wear them with boots so it’s kind of like a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Already Cracked.
customer_reviews.text: While using these fins they worked perfectly. However in the short couple of weeks that I have been using them, one of them already cracked. I only used these fins to train indoor pools. Make sure to wear these with booties.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for what you pay it’s the cheapest I could find on amazon and it hasn’t broken and I’ve have it for 2 months now
customer_reviews.author: Naah Conway

customer_reviews.title: Heavy fin
customer_reviews.text: It was a good durable fins but once it used them, they seemed to heavy for a fin and had to adjust my weights in my BC to compensate buoyancy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Niday

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: well package and delivered on time - great product. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rocourt

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: These are very good fins, they help me a lot for my workout before going in to the navy. The only bad thing i can say is that i had a blister on my toe but that is something you cant prevent, also my recruiters told me to get them.
customer_reviews.author: Chuska

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Only set of fins I use now. The weight and material are excellent. I regularly use them in the ocean for scuba diving and haven't had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great fins.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality fin if you are already a professional diver or in the military trying out for special forces. Not for beginners. The strap is okay could be better but it does its job. I was a little worried because of the many people highly overexaggerating how low quality the strap was. Not the case for me they work and hold up nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bh0209

customer_reviews.title: Size Chart
customer_reviews.text: Size chart is not accurate..... says a US mens size 9 is XL..... package came and actual size for XL is US 11-13
customer_reviews.author: John  Buchan

customer_reviews.title: Size chart is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Seem pretty sturdy however the size chart is wrong and now I have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These fins are powerful, stiff, and i use them every dive
customer_reviews.author: AHR_Artist

customer_reviews.title: Good prep fins
customer_reviews.text: Solid pair of fins. Start slow if your ankles are new to finning.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Same fin, no shine
customer_reviews.text: I got these to train for Pararescue this summer before I enlist. My best friends brother just graduated recon and said they are perfect for military amphibious training. I train with my workout buddy who bought the official "SEAL" version, he's leaving for BUD/s soon, there is no differennce besides a stupid Logo on the anterior portion of the fins. And it's a little more shiny. I paid $50 for these he paid $100. Rocket fins don't float, they are extremely powerful, and they feel like swimming with cardboard and cinderblocks. So suck it up, it's gets easier. They don't come with inserts, I advise you get some to preserve their life.
customer_reviews.author: TexasSARMedic

customer_reviews.title: What a great knock off at a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: Almost identical to the original "real" rocket fins that I had been using for 30+ years. What a great knock off at a fantastic price. I hope these last nearly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are really good, but just really stiff for it being brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Lanuza

customer_reviews.title: FUTURE CCT
customer_reviews.text: Great Fins for young people training to enter the Military.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great fins
customer_reviews.text: I bought these fins to dive in Puerto Rico's sea and they work perfect, good quality material, they make you fly in water.!!
customer_reviews.author: Grboom

customer_reviews.title: Great Fins!
customer_reviews.text: I talked with a former Navy diver who recommended these fins. I couldn't be happier! Looking forward to using them on our next trip to Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wetzler

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the largest size for my 14E foot and the boots they recommended. The overly wide pocket makes for a sloppy ...
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and the foot pocket is very wide. I purchased the largest size for my 14E foot and the boots they recommended. The overly wide pocket makes for a sloppy fit. Now, perhaps that would change with better quality boot. The recommended boots are entry level at best, not military grade like the fins.Why they paired the two ..... who knows but defiantly don't get those boots/socks with these fins. Not sending mine back I don't have time mess with this, I'll have make my own modifications for a fix.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable fins. You will definitely want fin boots ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable fins. You will definitely want fin boots, fin socks are just not enough padding, at least starting out.
customer_reviews.author: reagan kurfman

customer_reviews.title: Great all around fins
customer_reviews.text: These palm are great, not as heavy as turtle or rocket fins but stiff enough, pocket wall is a bit to high in front but can easily be trimmed down to proper proportion. Provide great propulsion and control.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Paulin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: These fins aren't bad, however they are very heavy, lack much flexibility, and take much strength to use. If you don't have very strong legs I wouldn't get them. Also, the strap broke on me pretty early on.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Max agility, good durability, but they're fairly rigid, heavy, and not solid toe (much resistance in the kick so be aware if you're not very fit). These are Taiwan knockoffs of Aqua Lung Rocket fins (and a very good knockoff considering that these are nearly half price).
customer_reviews.author: WhippinYoLegs

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Heavy fins, but good for training treading water and working on leg strength. Very durable and they stay seated in the cleats well and won't readjust themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Military grade. High performance turbo fins once broken in ...
customer_reviews.text: Military grade. High performance turbo fins once broken in. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Quent

customer_reviews.title: very good quality
customer_reviews.text: When I got mine I was surprised by the quality of the fins. Highly recommend these to anyone who is looking for a good set of fins for a good value. These are very durable and I love the feel of them.
customer_reviews.author: Anatoliy

customer_reviews.title: Very solid - but too basic
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a solid (and heavy) fin that will survive any amount of abuse, this is probably what you are looking for. If you are looking for something lightweight and attractive, these are not for you. FYI: I ordered the XXL since I wear size US15 shoes (with a 14.5 foot). They are definitely sized right (even with room to spare).
customer_reviews.author: Jeremey Donovan

customer_reviews.title: As good as the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: After an extended search for a similar fins used by Navy Seals I decided to settle on these. Yes, they are knock offs but damn good knock offs. I saved a lot of money as these were 50$ and new while the navy seals fins used start at 50-60$. (mostly requiring change of straps which cost an extra 25$). The new ones start at 90$ and up. I bought these fins to mostly complete a costume for a movie but I did had a go with them in a pool. They work excellent and look great too. I highly recommend these fins. They are sturdy built and look great too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Karwowski

customer_reviews.title: Great fins--fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these knock-offs to replace a pair of the originals I bought in 95. I was trying to decide between these old-school and a pair of the lightweight modern ones. I bought these after liking my original pair and went diving with them recently. They worked perfectly. They are indestructible and you can't beat the price. For sizing, I wear a size 11 shoe, and for diving in CA I wear a hard sole bootie and the XXL fin fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Chuck J. Rylant

customer_reviews.title: ... clips that hold the straps can pop out fairly easy. Other than that
customer_reviews.text: The clips that hold the straps can pop out fairly easy. Other than that, great durable fin. Strengthens calves and ankles well.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Bouren

customer_reviews.title: Solid set of fins
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them in open water yet but they seem like a pretty solid, essential set of fins. They're very basic but that's all you need. No flashy colors or anything which is great for me because most of what I do is salvage diving. To give you an idea for sizing, I wear a size 9 bootie with a VERY thick boot style sole. I got a size XL fin and they fit over the boots snugly. The strap seems kind of flimsy but I plan to replace it with an aftermarket set of spring straps, which I would reccomend to any diver with any set of fins.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fins are great but I received two different sized fins..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fins I usually outswim anyone else in the water ...
customer_reviews.text: I was issued my first pair of these in the Navy 15 years ago, I finally wore them out, although I think it was because I had too big of dive boot on. Great fins I usually outswim anyone else in the water with me and they last a long time without any headaches, looking forward to another 15years.​
customer_reviews.author: Chris Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Phonies
customer_reviews.text: Not real rockrt fins but do the trick. Not sturdy but if you don't have to fin for time they will work
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Legit badass flippers!
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and should last a life time, or so I assume. I lost one today to murky waters, The weather was horrible as well. Heavy clouds and mist did not aid my situation visually. Im going to have to buy another pair, really sucks. Lesson learned, spent 3 hours looking for it until it got to dark. They smell though. They stink up my bedroom with a heavy smell but it's nothing crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: As Good As The Original
customer_reviews.text: My original fins died about 5 years ago and the replacements were not half as good as these. I like that they are negatively buoyant - it means I need less weight when diving. The price was reasonable and they are great for diving.
customer_reviews.author: Aircarl

customer_reviews.title: Great fins
customer_reviews.text: These fins are great! Just like rocket fins or scuba pro, and they are much cheaper. I wear a size 9 shoe and i use 2mm dive socks. I bout the large, I wish I would have bought the size smaller, they still fit good.
customer_reviews.author: laine brown

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: They were cheaper than in any store I checked in. I still have them and they are great for open water.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Michael Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Overall reasonably good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: fast, durable, inexpensive. Cons: extremely heavy, straps fragile. The straps broke almost immediately upon beginning to adjust them. Based on advice from a dive shop employee I replaced them with shock cord and it works very well, but be warned that you either have to be really, really careful or replace them off the bat. You will also need thick-soled booties or your feet will tire out very quickly. These aren't designed for inexperienced recreational divers, but for commercial and military divers wearing heavy-duty gear.
customer_reviews.author: bigscience

customer_reviews.title: Fin-tastic
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, timely receipt of order and they work as described. Have had set before and never disappointed. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Carl Hanlon

customer_reviews.title: Swim fins
customer_reviews.text: These things are extremely stiff right out of the box. I hope that limber up!
customer_reviews.author: Jomcdilda

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a while now in pool for diver training and they have performed excellent. Size 10.5 foot with a great fit using promate 5mm hard sole boots.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great fins!
customer_reviews.text: Fins are awesome and the value is even better! These knock offs are so identical to the originals. Very satisfied with product!
customer_reviews.author: Maverick117

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got these to help prep for AFSOC. Extremely effective. Be sure to get booties too.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, cheap, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Returned because they are way too wide and not nearly deep enough. They are cheap, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: These fins are great. you need booties with them and the tilos are the ones for the job. They're heavy but you move like a mako shark through the water
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Change the name to Cinderblock Fins!
customer_reviews.text: Might as well strap cinderblocks on my feet. These fins are "stupid" heavy and the strap is terrible. The fins fell off my feet multiple times. I'm just thankful that I tried them in the pool first. I ended up buying Oceanic Split Fins with a spring strap, which was like the difference between heaven (split fins) and hell (IST cinderblock fins).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the style and function, but the latch system is terrible and can't be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Geer

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I got these for scuba diving/spearfishing. They are the worst , don't buy these!! I bought a nice pair of long blades on amazon that are awesome
customer_reviews.author: Michael Juan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE... LISTEN TO THIS ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE... LISTEN TO THIS REVIEW.... JUST SPEND AN EXTRA 50 BUCKS ON THE REAL DEAL AQUA ROCKET FINS IF YOUR TRAINING FOR THE MILITARY... I want to be a rescue swimmer in the USCG, and Ive trained with actual rescue swimmers... the fins they use are much heavier, and bigger and a lot harder to swim with. These fins are just stiff, EXTREMELY smaller than the original ones and whoever gives this a 5 or 4 or even 3 star reviews has no idea what they are doing in terms of training.... don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Brick fins
customer_reviews.text: I felt duped. I was looking for "jet" fins, in my ADD my search returned "rocket" fins. If u like bricks on your feet, these are a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: B.L.

customer_reviews.title: really?
customer_reviews.text: was really excited to finally recieve these fins...until i opened the box... and there was no straps... really? ... other than that they are really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: chaz

customer_reviews.title: easy answer
customer_reviews.text: if youve ever been in tough blackwater your gonna want good backup and here they are although not completely milspec you glide in rough water with these fellas they are a good survival tool if you need to bug out silent and fast .. they are strong and give ease of movement
customer_reviews.author: ArmageddonMarksman@yahoo

product_meta.title: IST Rubber Rocket Scuba Diver Fins, Military Special Ops Gear, Deep Sea Diving Heavy Duty Equipment
feature_bullets: DURABLE DESIGN — Strong rubber design is longlasting and premium-grade.
MILITARY CHOICE — #1 choice for Special Ops and U.S. Navy SEAL program.
SPECIAL CONSTRUCTION — Curvature and tapered blade for better propulsion.
JET STYLE — Deep grooves channel water backwards for a powerful kick.
OPEN BACK — Designed to be worn with dive booties, size chart includes boots

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
